question: What the hell were you thinking?
answer: Get them in the lab!

question: Not so fast Yllo! There's a protocol here.
answer: Back off! Get them to the labs . . . Now! What the hell are you doing?

question: My god! This is way over your head, pal. We need to call some experts and . . .
answer: I am an expert!

question: You're a teacher.
answer: Brodski I'll talk slow so you can understand me. She's thawing. If we don't get her to the lab, she'll die, and that will be on your bald fucking head!

question: How do you know that piece of cursed rock down there doesn't carry something metal tits can't detect?
answer: Well, when we rejuvenate this one you can ask her.

question: Damnit, Yllo! I don't like it.
answer: I don't give a shit. This one's prime for decryonization. We're brining her back.

question: I still think we should send for a team of real scientists.
answer: I am a scientist you asshole! This could be the most important discovery in 400 years. Do you have any idea what a find like this could mean?

question: Right now, I care only for the safety of this crew. You don't know anything about these two - Jesus what the hell is that?
answer: That's exactly what we need to find out. Check your orders, Sergeant. I out rank you where discovery is concerned. Now step aside. I have a medical emergency to deal with.

question: Get her prepped for the soup. Take the other one to lab two.
answer: Yllo, this is my find. My project. I want to be in here.

question: I know, dear, but this is too big a discovery. I need you to prep the second body.
answer: But, I want . . .

question: Adrienne?! Of all people!
answer: You're jealous.

question: Adrienne?!
answer: It's over between us. You're the one I want.

question: Secure line. Perez, Joshua, Solaras Space Lab. Connect.
answer: You son of a bitch, you know what time it is?

question: We just left old Earth. You'll never believe what we found. I'm sending you the files.
answer: Yeah, yeah if this is another ancient Farrari . . .

question: Trust me. I'm bypassing regular channels. See what kind of payday we're looking at.
answer: Alright, I'm . . . No way . . . is this a joke?

question: Kkinsa rips off Stoney's shirt. Stoney grab her and rolls on top of her.
answer: CLOSE ON JASON'S HAND - it curls, the frozen joints CRACKLE.

question: Stoney and Kkinsa kiss passionately as they wrestle to get each other's pants off.
answer: Adrienne tries to pry the Mask off . . . but it holds firm.

question: Help me! Anyone! Somebody help me! Hey! You son of a bitch!
answer: Cryo-Unit activated. Cryo-Unit leak. Lock down in progress. Security measures on line.

question: Nooooooo! Somebody! No!
answer: Subject in computer unit has reached full incubation.

question: Where..? Who . . .? I'm alive. You brought me back.
answer: Obviously so.

question: What the hell is this shit? How did I get here, how did you bring me back?
answer: Nanotechnology.

question: Nano...but nanotechnology is impossible.
answer: We've had Nano-Tech for the last 30 years.

question: 30? How long was I out?
answer: The year is 2455. You've been frozen for the past four hundred years. Now lay back we need to do some tests and I have some questions...

question: JASON?! WHERE IS HE?!
answer: The hockey player? He a friend of yours?

question: Hockey player? He's not a ...
answer: He's dead! Everyone's dead! Old Earth is dead!

question: Come on. Rizzo?
answer: Yeah?

question: I thought that after 400 hundred years, you just might have a little bit of an appetite. You're on Grendel, a class IV Catamaran transport. It's basically a school bus. We're on our way back to Earth II. It's finals week.
answer: You're telling me I'm a friggen class project?

question: Well?
answer: She needs a little time.

question: More time...shit, she's had 400 years...
answer: That's really funny.

question: I'd want her statements before we reach porch. Jesus, women.
answer: Yeah, like you'd be a rock after everything she went through?

question: That's nine to four, geek-boy.
answer: You got lucky.

question: You got lucky. I could have waited until he ate your head.
answer: Speaking of which, duck! What the?!

question: He's good. That sucks. Why won't he go down?
answer: Pause play.

question: He's not part of the program.
answer: Hey cool. They brought ancient hockey guy back to life. Hey! We're playing a game here. Get off the court!

question: No, we're playing a game...not you numbnuts...
answer: Asshole that does not count as a kill.

question: Yes it does.
answer: Oh, come on!

question: Okay, enough of this shit.
answer: Alright, asshole. Clear off the court, asshole.

question: I don't have all day, kid.
answer: Yeah yeah I better call the labs, see what the hell is going on. Lab...this is AZ in the game grid. Your guy got out and runined our game.

question: ALL I'm saying is dock with Space Lab, couple of hours no more. Let them take a look at our friends.
answer: Not a chance.

question: JUst don't go in there half cocked. You guys have a tendency to blow shit up and ask questions later.
answer: You got that right.

question: This thing could be worth a great deal.... scientifically...not to mention what the fat cats on Earth II would pay for it! Look, I'll split it with you 50/50...
answer: You sumbitch! Three dead! On my watch! If that...that thing is out there, it's dead! You got it!!!

question: Fat Lou, we're changing courses for the Solaras Space Lab.
answer: I'll need the sergeant's okay on that.

question: We've got a situation here! Just do as you're told!
answer: Alright, relax. 20 minutes. Soon as we've passed Tara's rings we'll make the course correction.

question: Then we wait. We're docking with Space Lab in less than an hour.
answer: What good will that do?

question: They can deal with this sort of thing.
answer: More soldiers?

question: Scientists. Very intellegent men.
answer: That's great. I bet they'll kick Jason's ass at a spelling bee!

question: Which way?
answer: What?

question: Ssh. He's in here. You scream I'll snap your neck. Got it?
answer: How do you know?

question: We must assume the machete was an intricate part of the game of hockey.
answer: I'm thinking Rizzo was right.

question: Thinking with your dick again, Delongpre?
answer: Maybe we should go with them. Like you said, your Space Lab connections can deal with this thing. At least we'll be safe.

question: The left side of Grendel SMASHES into the side of Space Lab!
answer: Suddenly everything shifts toward the bridge. Boxes, cargo, kids, and Jason!

question: Grendel SLIDES along SPACE LAB, ripping huge chunks of metal from both. SPARK fly. There are interior EXPLOSIONS on Space Lab, then --
answer: The entire ship shifts upwards. Cargo, crew, and Jason fly into the air.

question: Rizzo! Can you hear me?!
answer: Yeah. Are you guys okay?

question: There's a red lever on the wall beside you. Pull it!
answer: It's locked!

question: Then break it! If you don't pull it, the ship's going to depressurize! Hurry Rizzo! You have to reverse the pressurization. What are you doing?!!
answer: If the ship goes, so does Jaso.

question: Rizzo pull the fucking lever!
answer: No.

question: Hey.
answer: That's a good fantasy, though. Kinky, but good.

question: Hey!! What's this?
answer: It's the engine, reactors, audiometers, it's the stuff that makes the ship go zoom.

question: What if we blow the walkways first? Leave Jason over here to go up with the ship?
answer: You know, Yllo seemed to think we could catch this guy alive, well, he'd be worth millions.

question: Any connection between your reality and mine is purely coincidental.
answer: I'm just saying.

question: Put your finger here. My father wanted me to be a businessman. That's why I'm here.
answer: So, you thought you'd be cool. Go against your father's wishes? Yeah, that's grown up.

question: My father's company imports and exports. Archaeology is part of the business. We happen to get along just fine, smartass. Look, why don't you bust somebody else's balls for a change.
answer: I thought you meant...

question: Sorry, you were saying?
answer: I got along great with my father, my mother too. Dad and the others thought they could learn a great deal from this thing the army had been keeping on ice for over a hundred years. They were all wrong. They couldn't control him.

question: And what happend to ...?
answer: I couldn't save them.

question: Where is everybody? What happened?
answer: Damnit! You scared the hell out of me!

question: Give me a break! What happened?
answer: Jason. He's what happened. Then Grendel hit Space Lab.

question: Space Lab?! Wait'll I get my hands on Yllo.
answer: Yllo's dead. We...we thought you were too.

question: Takes more than a steelbalde to take this old dog down. Yup, that ought'a do it.
answer: Lights a flare, blinding Jason for the moment. Then she sinks the Rhino syringe into his chest! Jason stumbles...falls hard on his ass and sits there staring at her. Well go on! Pass out! Shit.

question: Faster! Don't we have another gun?
answer: They're not gonna make it. Close the door before he gets us all.

question: They'll make it.
answer: Close the fucking door!

question: Shut up, Thorgan!
answer: Delongpre, you don't even know me.

question: I know you. Nooooooo!!
answer: grapples with Jason, but JASON IS JUST TOO STRONG.

question: Rizzo, pull away!
answer: I'm stuck!

question: You okay?!
answer: Oh great...yeah, having a great time, and you?

question: No thank you, you crazy old woman.
answer: Old woman?

question: Well I mean, technically you are old enough to be my great, great, great...
answer: I get it.
